segments.text: I see the woman at the sink, so focused on drying that plate, completely unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost comical how she doesn’t notice the water overflowing, creating a little lake at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but smile at the thought of how peaceful the garden looks outside, contrasting with the mess inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dress and apron make her look like the perfect image of domestic life, yet there’s danger lurking beneath her obliviousness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children, though, oh, they’re up to something mischievous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on that rickety stool climbing for cookies makes my heart race.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn’t he realize he could fall at any moment? It’s like an accident waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
